TopicTitle: How do I get this device in space?

Articles.Content:
How do I get this non-obvious 'mystery' device, capable of pure scientific wonders beyond the imagination, in space (preferably to a distant celestial body).

As you can see, it's oddly shaped and hard to attach anything to. Does anyone have any ideas? I can't wait to do so much science with this.

hyperedit would be my guess... http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/hyperedit/

Someone going skateboarding on the Mun?
I dunno, but didn't someone make a F-1 racing rover? That might be fun
I believe a rocket motor of some sort could be used to propel it. But I seem to remember them needing something, Hmmmm.

Get a connector, a decoupler to decouple the connector, and use large rockomax fuel tanks/engines and maybe use them in asparagus-style staging.

I haven't had to put anything like that in space, so I'm not sure, but I think that might work if you can handle it properly.

Doesn't look too heavy. Just put 2 of them in symetry on a lifter.

Knowing the mass would be nice.

Just put a aspargus rocket system underneath and try to position it so that it is more or less balanced.

I have sent up stuff that is much less symmetrical than this.

You know, looking at it again, all I think you'd need to do it poke a small strut right at the center of mass, attach a decoupler to that and build lifter with wings for stabilizers to offset the ramp's aerodrag. You only need to worry about that for a little bit, so you can punch the wings off with one of the earlier stages I'd think.

Oh, and piles of space tape obviously
